item.title: Start MongoDB as service
item.description: 1. start MongoDB normally Once you installed MongoDB on your PC, you can start MongoDB using mongod --dbpath C:\MongoDB\Server\3.6\data\db 2. start MongDB as service remove the existing MongDB service intall the MongoDB as a service start the MongoDB service stop the MongoDB service mongod --remove mongod --dbpath=D:\MongoDB\Server\3.6\data\db --logpath=D:\MongoDB\Server\3.6\logs\log.txt --install net start MongoDB net stop MongoDB When you install or remove MongoDB service to or from you computer, you can add the `–serviceName YourServiceName’ flag after the command to customize the service name as you wish.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This sample post is mainly for blogdown users. If you do not use blogdown, you can skip the first section. 1. Markdown or R Markdown This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc.
